sentences.english: Jotham rebuilt the Upper Gate of the temple of the Lord .
sentences.chinese: 约坦建立耶和华殿的上门。

sentences.english: And Jotham his son succeeded him as king.
sentences.chinese: 他儿子约坦管理家事，治理国民。

sentences.english: As for the other events of Jotham's reign, and what he did, are they not written in the book of the annals of the kings of Judah?
sentences.chinese: 约坦其余的事，凡他所行的都写在犹大列王记上。

sentences.english: Jotham rested with his fathers and was buried in the City of David.
sentences.chinese: 约坦与他列祖同睡，葬在大卫城里。

sentences.english: Jotham grew powerful because he walked steadfastly before the Lord his God.
sentences.chinese: 约坦在耶和华他神面前行正道，以致日渐强盛。

sentences.english: And Ahaz his son succeeded him as king.
sentences.chinese: 他儿子约坦接续他作王。

sentences.english: The curse of Jotham son of Jerub-Baal came on them.
sentences.chinese: 耶路巴力的儿子约坦的咒诅归到他们身上了。

sentences.english: But Jotham, the youngest son of Jerub-Baal, escaped by hiding.
sentences.chinese: 只剩下耶路巴力的小儿子约坦，因为他躲藏了。

definition: Josiah or Yoshiyahu (649-609 BC), a king of Judah (Judaism)
Hezekiah or Ezekias (740-687 BC), twelfth king of Judah (Judaism)
Jehu (842-815 BC), Israelite king, prominent character in 2 Kings 9:10
Ahab (9th c. BC), King of Israel, son of Omri and husband of Jezebel, prominent figure in 1 Kings 16-22
